example.mysports.ejb
Class LeagueRepository

java.lang.Object
  example.mysports.ejb.LeagueRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class LeagueRepository
extends Object
implements Serializable

MySports Domain Model Repository providing simplified persistence facade for managing the application bootstrapped EntityManagerFactory that are tenant aware.

Since:
EclipseLink 2.3.0
Author:
dclarke
See Also:

getAdditionalAttributes

public List<Attribute<?,?>> getAdditionalAttributes(Class<?> entityType)
Determine which mapped attributes are virtual/extended attributes. Used to provide dynamic access to these attributes in presentation layer.

Returns:
list of extended (virtual) JPA meta-model attributes
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if entityType is not a managed type

unwrap

public <T> T unwrap(Class<T> cls)
Provide access to internals of repository similar to EntityManager.unwrap(Class). Provided for access to advanced capabilities of the underlying EclipseLink persistence unit as well as for testing access to internals.

close

@PreDestroy
public void close()
Close this league repository forcing the underlying EntityManagerFactory to be closed as well.

initialize

public void initialize()
After the stateful session bean is activated after passivation the createEMF(String, Map)is called with the stored leagueId to populate the persistence state necessary for use.

getJAXBContext

public JAXBContext getJAXBContext()
Create an EclipseLink JAXBContext which is built from the combined with the virtual attribute extended mappings returned from the call to the Admin server.
